fibre co cumbria fingering dodd wood 300m/328yd per 100g mc & malabrigo arroyo 248 petrichor 305m/335yd held with shibui silk cloud pollen 300m/330yd per 25g cc 2 the fibre co cumbria fingering dodd suggest having at least 160yd/150m of mc and 70yd/65m of cc this will depend on your yarn choice but this is the maximum yardage you should need for these instructions using the tested yarn combinations if you re short on mc you can always knit one of the first half of the folded brim in cc to conserve mc abbreviations k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 together ssk slip 2 sts knit wise to the techniques special stitches provisional cast on i suggest reviewing the purl soho 2-step method for provisional cast on found here https //www purlsoho com/create/provisional-cast-on/ 2-handed stranded color work in the round brooklyn tweed has a great tutorial on this here https //brooklyntweed com/pages/stranded-colorwork-101 i highly recommend holding the mc in the right hand and the cc in the left hand and when floats are more than 4 sts wide holding the cc in between the needles and the wrap of the mc to hold the float on the ws of the work folded brim kelbourne woolens has a
